This was supposed to be about Lisa.‚Äù  And everything clicked. Kyle has always wanted to be the ‚ÄúQueen B‚Äù and when she realized how popular LVP was she couldn‚Äôt stand it. I mean it‚Äôs crazy that it started as early as season 2. Kyle continuously grouped women together to try to attack Lisa and it has always failed, up until puppy gate. On the same episode when Taylor is at the gate with Paul she says ‚Äúthey all said they would have my back.‚Äù Clearly this was a preplanned attack. I think about this all the time.. I‚Äôve been trying to ‚Äútrain my brain‚Äù to think differently but it‚Äôs so hard. I second guess everything and I wish I didn‚Äôt.

I‚Äôm sorry to hear that. 
I am actually on the other end of a situation like this right now, but I‚Äôve been on your end as well. I can tell you from experience, it does push people away. As sad as it is to say, people grow apart. I‚Äôm not saying that‚Äôs the case with all friendships, but sometimes a friendship might just need a break. 
I was friends with someone for over 10 years and when I noticed that she was distancing herself from me I pushed her away. Now we see each other every once in awhile and it‚Äôs normal and it goes back to how it used to be. There are so many other people out there that will care for you the way you care for them. A length of a friendship shouldn‚Äôt be a reason for you to put up with them ditching you or making you feel insignificant. I struggled with this for a few years, I wanted my childhood friends to stay my best friends because that‚Äôs what we always promised each other.  Until I realized I felt like I was begging for a minute of their time just because they were so important to me. I learned it‚Äôs best to not hold on so tightly, because it does push people away. And while you‚Äôre focusing on there friends that don‚Äôt value you for who you are, you‚Äôre losing sight of people that truly care and will meet your friendship needs. 
I hope this helps, if you need to talk feel free to reach out. Friendships are tough to let go of.

I‚Äôve gone through this with friends before. It‚Äôs just  part of life, you‚Äôre outgrowing the drama and phony stuff. That‚Äôs perfectly okay! I wondered if I was in the wrong, but now I‚Äôm certain with my decisions. I had a friend that tried to start drama between my friends and I just distanced myself from her. There‚Äôs no point in dealing with people that make you miserable.

I‚Äôve dealt with a situation like this before. 
There are two options, one is ignore them.
Two (which is what I prefer) is tell them that you think you are just in two different places in life, it‚Äôs a nice way of saying you‚Äôve outgrown one another. You may find a certain way to say it because you know more than I do on how this friend will respond to thing. Ending a friendship is a lot like a breakup. I don‚Äôt recommend telling them everything that‚Äôs wrong with y‚Äôall‚Äôs friendship or anything that will make it end on a bad note.
Best of luck! It‚Äôs hard to break-up with friends, but if it‚Äôs toxic it‚Äôs worth it.

My cousins and I are going on a trip for one of my cousins birthday. I'm bestfriends with my cousins so we hang out with the same group. We needed an extra person after someone backed out so I invited our friend H on the trip, because she knows the hosts and she gets along with everyone.  Well, our friend A started freaking the fuck out because she wasn't invited. 

A doesn't know the hosts of the trip that well, it's the bday boy and his GF.  She BEGGED the hosts to invite her when we weren't in the room... they said there wasn't any room left so they thought she would drop it, but she kept insisting. Saying " I have the money RIGHT NOW. I can send it, RIGHT NOW." Like what on earth makes anyone think that is okay??? 

She brings it up to my cousin "R," (we met A through R). and basically says she's so sad she wasn't invited and her feelings are hurt. mind you, this is for our COUSIN'S birthday. She even said "it's pretty close to my birthday." trying to make my cousin's trip about her? 

A week passes, THEN she corners my cousin  K (part of the friend group)  and talks about how upset she is that she isn't invited/going. K  is like "dang i'm sorry it's not my trip.." So at this point you would think she would get it.. but NO. She texts R AGAIN  and says she is thinking of getting an Air B&B on the same weekend because she wants to go SO badly. Finally R just tells her that she's making it really uncomfortable because she's trying to force herself into our cousin's trip. It's not personal, it's just not our trip to invite people on. 

Sounds like an entitled teenager right? Wrong, she's almost 30. 

Just had to let that out lol

Thank you for sharing your thoughts and opinions without calling me names. I really enjoy seeing posts like this, especially since you were a huge (even paying) fan. I do hope things get better. I hope the show does get better and I hope Mike becomes a little more sensitive to listeners.
